text: Two different times last night someone went to destroy a Mirage Mirror only to have it turned into a non-artifact. That always makes me smile.

If I'd made a best of 2017, Mirage Mirror is without a doubt at the top. That kind of versatility that goes into any deck just doesn't come along very often. It's also not tough, on average, to leave 2 mana up.
I mean, a Boros deck can copy a Gaea's Cradle and tap to get mana for each token...
Doesn't matter that it's green...it's mana...
It's the stupid little stuff that you don't plan for that make it so good. I cast my Hornet Queen and copied someone else's Panharmonicon.
I copied someone's Paradox Engine one game....
I've mana fixed with it before just copying a land
I've copied Cabal Coffers more than once.
It's why I like Sudden Spoiling so much, it just does something every time
Yup...I was just thinking I wish WotC would give us a commander with Split Second.
Even an uncounterable commander can be deal with by exiling the stack, putting spells back in the deck effects, etc. Split Second eliminates all that.
The very existence of Blood Sun indicates they are apparently ok with wonky rules ineractions
Indeed...I mean, I was thinking it would be in a precon where they can do whatever they want mechanically.
I don't think putting Split Second into standard is probably necessary.
i think we always need more split second
if only because activated abilities have been buffed into the stratosphere
Even if activated abilities are deemed stronger than they used to be, I don't think that Split Second is the answer. I want answers that work because I made the right choice for the situation.
Split Second is a cool mechanic, but its inherent un-interactiveness makes it very frustrating, in my opinion
Yes. Very Un-interactive for those damn tricky Blue mages.
The real answer to split second is triggered abilities
Sure but relevant triggered abilities are hard to come by that stop things.
thoughts in marath enchantress? could be good since most of my creatures are dinky
Yup...I pegged this as one of the best cards of RIX. It's rare to get a 3-mana wrath without a real downside.
Doran decks’ll get a kick outta that
Here is my RIX update list. Open to feedback

*Mono Black*
Vona's Hunger


*Grenzo*
Etali, Primal Storm
Tilonalli's SUmmoner
The Immortal Sun
Azor's Gateway


*Marath Enchantress*
Slaughter the strong


*Taniwha*
Timestream Navigator
Azor's Gateway


*Adun Oakenshield*
Thrashing Brontodon
Journey to Eternity
World Shaper
I love Tilonalli's Summoner for Grenzo
[[vona’s hunger]]

If you have the city's blessing, instead each opponent sacrifices half the creatures he or she controls, rounded up.

text: that seems correct.
Yeah. That’s a card.
I really wish [[Zacama]] was Jund

text: I always feel like cards like Vonas Hunger are too scattershot
At it's minimum it's an instant speed edict.
Like I either want to k ow I can clear the board with a wipe or hit the scary thing. I don’t rent to be unsure if I can do either
I’m sure it just generically is value to cast
You'll never get a 3-mana instant boardwipe, though.
They just won't print that. Sorcery-speed, yes.
For sure, I just don’t like the coin flip nature of edicts where a large portion of the time people have a 1/1 token or a already-did-it’s-thing Ewit
heads
Thanks slackbot
Their efficacy is probably meta dependent tho
It's rare to be at a table with 4 token decks...also you can cast this early to get 1 creature or wait until you have the blessing to get substantially more.
So in a way it scales with the game.
for the same mana cost.
The efficiency of being able to affect the board in such a way at instant speed for a spell that any black deck can cast shouldn't be ignored.
You can cast it early if you draw it early
That's any spell...now come on...
I just don’t like cards that o my work situationally and those situations aren’t ones you can always rely upon
Right but edicts tend to be on the less reliable tip
In my experience
Metas May alter that
Not in mine, so apparently it is more meta dependent than I suspect.
Typically there is a player who is less affected, but unless they're a dedicated token deck, if they have to sack half their creatures, that's a massive tempo hit.
Lotta ifs. I used to run Harsh Mercy in my sphinx deck which never hit me and could wreck some decks and was always value. The inconsistency was annoying though
There's only 1 if - do they sack 1 or more than 1 critter. If the one you want is out there since it's instant speed you can respond to their spell and force them to sack the one on the field, etc.
There’s also the if they have something they can sad they don’t care about
Sure...I know you hate anyone but you having a choice, but a lot of the time the choice isn't very good and you're still getting a lot of value for 3 mana.
That's the nature of edict effects.
Yep. It’s got prioritize consistency too much too
I'm not as big as you on consistency. Variability leads to more interesting games.
for me
I don't remember discussing [[!Slaughter the Strong]]. Is it just me, or is this a really good wrath?
Three mana, check. Can be one-sided/settle in your favor, check. Removes indestructible, check.
Aaaand discuss!
Not much to discuss...it's a very good wipe. Toss in Teferi's Protection and for 6 mana it's a 1-sided wipe all around.
is fine
That's Magical-landia, of course, it's a very good wipe at 3 mana.
I like it in Doran. If you’re pairing with TefPro a regular Wrath is probably fine already. It could be better than I think it is but it doesn’t blow me away at present
Look at it this way...at 3 mana, chances are I can start rebuilding the same turn I cast it, which isn't the case with a regular wrath.
[[dawn / dusk]] is a similar effect

attachments.fallback: More than one card matches “dawn / dusk”. Can you be be more specific?
attachments.text: More than one card matches “dawn / dusk”. Can you be be more specific?

text: Will anyone be replacing wrath of God with it?
I almost don’t run wrath anywhere right now
which is probably wrong
I'd try it out, honestly. The ability to get rid of indestructible critters is very good.
but I don’t have a ton of white decks
Do you think it's as good as Toxic Deluge?
It's obviously better than Bontu's Reckoning, right?
man I should reckoning into a hive mind sometime
Yes

I feel like Dana could do an In the Margins about Day of Judgment. Wrath is better, but fumigate feels better still, phyrexian reclamation is interesting, Rout can be an instant, hallowed burial evades indestructible, austere command is just brilliant, plus lots of multicolored options... Wrath has prestige and a lowish mana cost, and that’s good, but there are other neat wrath variants that deserve more attention than they currently get
I was running day of judgement for a while because I couldn’t find my wrath
then I found my supreme verdict and went with that
Phyrexian Rebirth?
That one
I always liked that
What about [[Tragic Arrogance]]?

attachments.text:

_The spear thrown by Kytheon's own hand was the weapon that felled his friends._

text: Day is on the list
Tragic Arrogance was never as good as I wanted it to be
I want to like tragic arrogance but the few times I’ve had it it felt dead in my hand
This fevered visions is killing me but I’m too greedy to remove it
playing against one right now?
Yeah
it’s how it gets you
That's a good card...
And I have a tragic arrogance in hand speaking of it
But Dana, you hate group hug.
it isn’t his visions
That ain't a hug...
I know but I’ve got a mana reflection in play so I get to play all the things
I got to give someone a rat with hungry lynx and when he clamped in flash in amps collector
Heart of the cards, <@U4V5EHQ2G>...that slow knife Fevered Visions pushes through your greedy little heart...;-)
So, Dana likes hug conditionally. Got it
I keep almost missing the Ahrabo giant growth trigger
It isn't a may ability...
So I don't really think you can miss it
well, you can, but a judge would issue a warning
To you for missing your own trigger, or to the table because it's everyone's responsibility to maintain the proper game state?
it’d probably be to the table
of course, it depends on how far the game has progressed
like, if it is just past the combat step, then they will rewind, issue a warning to the player
but if the turn has finished and such, then it would just be a warning I think
I mean, might be to the player
there are some rules about that stuff
Man, I love tragic arrogance. Always surprised it’s not more played than it is

So here’s an exercise I do whenever I cast a board wipe; I ask what things would look like if I ran a different option in that slot. It’s why I started running Merciless Eviction; there were so many times that if I had it it would just solve a problem that what I was holding wouldn’t solve. Using that same test with Tragic Arrogance was way more mixed that I would have thought. It can be really effective but there are a lot of times it felt like it would be underwhelming and I’d be better off with just a flat creature wipe like a wrath or a multi wipe like Hour or Akromas Vengence.
and what austere command is baller
Yup
Another one I found I almost never wanted was Explosive Veggies.
modal board wipes are the best
yeah, I don’t run it too often
I need a 7 cmc commander or more to want it
Every time I had veggies in hand I really wanted a two mana variant
or the three mana ones
Which really is Rampant, Nature’s Lore, Farseek, and Into the North since Three Visits is dumb pricey
Yeah
cultivate and reach are really nice because they can get you that land drop you missed
Yep
There’s a reason Veggies was ok for standard
the biggest change to my deck building this past year was how I think about ramp in general and the questions I ask myself  to get there
Same here
Though I’m still not running Vault or Crypt anywhere
I am, but only in decks that need it or can abuse it
Not that they aren’t great it that’s where the line is for me between being efficient and being competitive
because there is something really fun about getting mech production on a mana crypt
Lol
I can see that
I mean at some point, you think to yourself “I can’t justify using all this mana, and here comes more”
and then you lose because everyone is after you
Heh yup
